what: Convert arithmetic (character) format to numeric — arithmetic_to_numeric
title: Convert arithmetic (character) format to numeric — arithmetic_to_numeric
text: Convert arithmetic (character) format numeric

title: Convert arithmetic (character) format to numeric — arithmetic_to_numeric
code: arithmetic_to_numeric(x)

title: Convert arithmetic (character) format to numeric — arithmetic_to_numeric
text: x Character string containing arithmetic operators.

title: Convert arithmetic (character) format to numeric — arithmetic_to_numeric
text: numeric value evaluating arithmetic expression.

title: Convert arithmetic (character) format to numeric — arithmetic_to_numeric
code: # Return numeric values arithmetic_to_numeric("1/3") #> [1] 0.3333333 arithmetic_to_numeric("sqrt(2)") #> [1] 1.414214 arithmetic_to_numeric("log(2)") #> [1] 0.6931472 arithmetic_to_numeric("exp((-3^2)/2)/sqrt(2*pi)") #> [1] 0.004431848  # Return NA if containing non-arithmetic string arithmetic_to_numeric("1/3a") #> [1] NA

File input button — fileButtonInput
text: File input button.

title: File input button — fileButtonInput
code: fileButtonInput(   inputId,   label,   multiple = FALSE,   accept = NULL,   width = NULL,   buttonLabel = "Browse...",   placeholder = "No file selected" )

title: File input button — fileButtonInput
text: inputId input slot used access value. label Display label control, NULL label. multiple Whether user allowed select upload multiple files . work older browsers, including Internet Explorer 9 earlier. accept character vector "unique file type specifiers" gives browser hint type file server expects. Many browsers use prevent user selecting invalid file. unique file type specifier can : case insensitive extension like .csv .rds. valid MIME type, like text/plain application/pdf One audio/*, video/*, image/* meaning audio, video, image type, respectively. width width input, e.g. '400px', '100%'; see validateCssUnit(). buttonLabel label used button. Can text HTML tag object. placeholder text show file uploaded.

title: File input button — fileButtonInput
text: Button file input.

title: File input button — fileButtonInput
code:
fileButtonInput( "restore", label = NULL, buttonLabel = "Restore", multiple = FALSE, accept = ".rds", width = "50%" ) #>
#>
#> #>
#> #>
#>
#>

what: gMCPShiny: Shiny App for Graphical Multiplicity — gMCPShiny-package
title: gMCPShiny: Shiny App for Graphical Multiplicity — gMCPShiny-package
text: 'Shiny' app 'gMCPLite' graphical described multiple test procedures introduced Bretz et al. (2009) doi:10.1002/sim.3495  Bretz et al. (2011) doi:10.1002/bimj.201000239 . Contains instructions multiplicity graph graphical testing group sequential design, described Maurer Bretz (2013) doi:10.1080/19466315.2013.807748 . Implements multiplicity graph visualization reproducible code generation.

title: gMCPShiny: Shiny App for Graphical Multiplicity — gMCPShiny-package
text: Maintainer: Nan Xiao nan.xiao1@merck.com (ORCID) Authors: Yalin Zhu yalin.zhu@outlook.com (ORCID) Xuan Deng xuan.deng@merck.com Keaven Anderson keaven_anderson@merck.com Yilong Zhang elong0527@gmail.com contributors: Ivan Sagalaev (highlight.js library) [contributor, copyright holder] bslib contributors (navbarPage implementation bslib) [contributor, copyright holder] shiny contributors (navbarPage implementation shiny) [contributor, copyright holder] fs contributors (path_sanitize implementation fs) [contributor, copyright holder] Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, NJ, USA affiliates [copyright holder]

title: Adaptive color palette generator for hGraph — hgraph_palette
code: hgraph_palette(   pal_name = c("gray", "Okabe-Ito", "d3.category10", "d3.category20", "d3.category20b",     "d3.category20c", "Teal"),   n,   alpha = 1 )

title: Adaptive color palette generator for hGraph — hgraph_palette
text: pal_name Color palette name. n many different colors selected color palette? alpha Transparency level, real number (0, 1].

title: Adaptive color palette generator for hGraph — hgraph_palette
text: vector color hex values.

title: Adaptive color palette generator for hGraph — hgraph_palette
code: hgraph_palette("gray", n = 10) #>  [1] "#4D4D4DFF" "#6C6C6CFF" "#838383FF" "#969696FF" "#A7A7A7FF" "#B5B5B5FF" #>  [7] "#C3C3C3FF" "#CFCFCFFF" "#DBDBDBFF" "#E6E6E6FF" hgraph_palette("Okabe-Ito", n = 15) #>  [1] "#E69F00FF" "#9EA974FF" "#56B4E9FF" "#2BA9AEFF" "#009E73FF" "#77C15AFF" #>  [7] "#F0E442FF" "#77AB7AFF" "#0072B2FF" "#6A6859FF" "#D55E00FF" "#D06B53FF" #> [13] "#CC79A7FF" "#B288A0FF" "#999999FF"

what: Create a page with a top level navigation bar within a fluid container — navbarFluidPage
title: Create a page with a top level navigation bar within a fluid container — navbarFluidPage
text: Slightly modified shiny::navbarPage() support: Navbar inside fluid container instead full width. Brand image title.

title: Create a page with a top level navigation bar within a fluid container — navbarFluidPage
code: navbarFluidPage(   title,   ...,   id = NULL,   selected = NULL,   position = c("static-top", "fixed-top", "fixed-bottom"),   header = NULL,   footer = NULL,   inverse = FALSE,   collapsible = FALSE,   fluid = TRUE,   theme = NULL,   windowTitle = NA,   lang = NULL,   brand_image,   brand_image_width,   brand_image_height )

title: Create a page with a top level navigation bar within a fluid container — navbarFluidPage
text: title title display navbar ... tabPanel() elements include page. navbarMenu function also accepts strings, used menu section headers. string set dashes like "----" horizontal separator displayed menu. id provided, can use input$id server logic determine current tabs active. value correspond value argument passed tabPanel(). selected value (, none supplied, title) tab selected default. NULL, first tab selected. position Determines whether navbar displayed top page normal scrolling behavior ("static-top"), pinned top ("fixed-top"), pinned bottom ("fixed-bottom"). Note using "fixed-top" "fixed-bottom" cause navbar overlay body content, unless add padding, e.g.: tags$style(type="text/css", "body   {padding-top: 70px;}") header Tag list tags display common header tabPanels. footer Tag list tags display common footer tabPanels inverse TRUE use dark background light text navigation bar collapsible TRUE automatically collapse navigation elements expandable menu mobile devices narrow window widths. fluid TRUE use fluid layout. FALSE use fixed layout. theme One following: NULL (default), implies "stock" build Bootstrap 3. bslib::bs_theme() object. can used replace stock build Bootstrap 3 customized version Bootstrap 3 higher. character string pointing alternative Bootstrap stylesheet (normally css file within www directory, e.g. www/bootstrap.css). windowTitle browser window title (character string). default value, NA, means use character strings appear title (none found, host URL page displayed default). lang ISO 639-1 language code HTML page, "en" "ko". used lang <html> tag, <html lang="en">. default (NULL) results empty string. brand_image Path brand image. brand_image_width Width brand image pixels. brand_image_height Height brand image pixels.

title: Create a page with a top level navigation bar within a fluid container — navbarFluidPage
text: page top level navigation bar within fluid container.

title: Create a page with a top level navigation bar within a fluid container — navbarFluidPage
code:
library(shiny) navbarFluidPage( "App Title", tabPanel("Plot"), tabPanel("Summary"), tabPanel("Table") ) #>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#> App Title #>
#>
    #>
  • #> Plot #>
    • #>
  • #> Summary #>
    • #>
  • #> Table #>
    • #>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#>

what: Render R code with syntax highlighting — renderRcode
title: Render R code with syntax highlighting — renderRcode
text: Renders R code syntax highlighting using highlight.js library.

title: Render R code with syntax highlighting — renderRcode
code: renderRcode(   expr,   env = parent.frame(),   quoted = FALSE,   outputArgs = list(),   delay = 100 )  rcodeOutput(outputId)

title: Render R code with syntax highlighting — renderRcode
text: expr expression evaluate. env parent environment reactive expression. default, calling environment, defining ordinary non-reactive expression. expr quosure quoted TRUE, env ignored. quoted TRUE, quote()ed value expr used expr evaluated. expr quosure like use expression value expr, must set quoted TRUE. outputArgs List additional arguments pass output function. delay Delay milliseconds syntax highlighting starts. outputId Output variable read R code .

title: Render R code with syntax highlighting — renderRcode
text: render function similar shiny::renderText().

title: Render R code with syntax highlighting — renderRcode

what: Render R Markdown with syntax highlighting — renderRmd
title: Render R Markdown with syntax highlighting — renderRmd
text: Renders R Markdown syntax highlighting using highlight.js library.

title: Render R Markdown with syntax highlighting — renderRmd
code: renderRmd(   expr,   env = parent.frame(),   quoted = FALSE,   outputArgs = list(),   delay = 100 )  rmdOutput(outputId)

title: Render R Markdown with syntax highlighting — renderRmd
text: expr expression evaluate. env parent environment reactive expression. default, calling environment, defining ordinary non-reactive expression. expr quosure quoted TRUE, env ignored. quoted TRUE, quote()ed value expr used expr evaluated. expr quosure like use expression value expr, must set quoted TRUE. outputArgs List additional arguments pass output function. delay Delay milliseconds syntax highlighting starts. outputId Output variable read R Markdown .

title: Render R Markdown with syntax highlighting — renderRmd
text: render function similar shiny::renderText().

title: Render R Markdown with syntax highlighting — renderRmd
code:
if (interactive()) {   library("shiny")    ui <- fluidPage(     fluidRow(       column(         4,         textAreaInput(           "rmd_in",           label = NULL,           width = "100%", height = "500px",           value = "---
title: Title
output: pdf_document
---

# Heading"         )       ),       column(         8,         rmdOutput("rmd_out")       )     )   )    server <- function(input, output) {     output$rmd_out <- renderRmd({       htmltools::htmlEscape(input$rmd_in)     })   }    shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server) }

title: Run Shiny app — run_app
text: Run Shiny app

title: Run Shiny app — run_app
code: run_app(port = getOption("shiny.port"))

title: Run Shiny app — run_app
text: port TCP port application listen . port specified, shiny.port option set (options(shiny.port = XX)), port used. Otherwise, use random port 3000:8000, excluding ports blocked Google Chrome considered unsafe: 3659, 4045, 5060, 5061, 6000, 6566, 6665:6669 6697. twenty random ports tried.

title: Run Shiny app — run_app
text: object represents app. Printing object passing shiny::runApp() run app.

title: Run Shiny app — run_app
code: if (interactive()) {   gMCPShiny::run_app() }

title: Sanitizes file name — sanitize_filename
text: Sanitizes file name (without extension part). Ported modified fs::path_sanitize().

title: Sanitizes file name — sanitize_filename
code: sanitize_filename(filename, replacement = "-")

title: Sanitizes file name — sanitize_filename
text: filename Input file name. replacement Replacement illegal characters.

title: Sanitizes file name — sanitize_filename
text: Sanitized file name.

title: Sanitizes file name — sanitize_filename
code: x <- " znul/zzz.z>z/\\z " paste0(sanitize_filename(x), ".rds") #> [1] "znul-zzz.z-z--z.rds"
